flixel.util.FlxColorUtil

type
class
Class containing a set of functions for color manipulation and color harmony.

Static Methods

HSVtoRGBA(H : Float, S : Float, V : Float, ?Alpha : Int) : Int

parameters
H Hue degree, between 0 and 359
S Saturation, between 0.0 (grey) and 1.0
V Value, between 0.0 (black) and 1.0
Alpha Alpha value to set per color (between 0 and 255)
returns
32-bit RGBA color value (0xAARRGGBB)
Convert a HSV (hue, saturation, lightness) color space value to an RGB color

inline RGBAtoHexString(Color : Int) : String

parameters
Color The color to get the String representation for
returns
A string of length 10 characters in the format 0xAARRGGBB
Return a String representation of the color in the format 0xAARRGGBB

inline RGBAtoRGB(Color : Int) : Int

parameters
Color The Color to convert
returns
The color without its alpha component
Turn a color with alpha and rgb values into a color without the alpha comoponent. Example: 0x55ff0000 becomes 0xff0000

inline RGBAtoWebString(Color : Int) : String

parameters
Color The color to get the String representation for
returns
A string of length 10 characters in the format 0xAARRGGBB
Return a String representation of the color in the format #RRGGBB

RGBtoHSV(Color : Int) : HSV

parameters
Color The color in format 0xRRGGBB
returns
Object with the properties hue (from 0 to 360), saturation (from 0 to 1.0) and lightness (from 0 to 1.0, also available under .value)
Convert an RGB color value to an object containing the HSV color space values: Hue, Saturation and Lightness

inline brighten(Color : Int, ?Factor : Float) : Int

parameters
Color In the format 0xAARRGGBB
Factor The higher, the lighter! Number from 0 to 1.0.
returns
The lightened color
Lighten an RGBA color.

inline colorToHexString(Color : Int) : String

parameters
Color The color channel to get the hex value for, must be a value between 0 and 255)
returns
A string of length 2 characters, i.e. 255 = FF, 0 = 00
Return a String containing a hex representation of the given color

inline darken(Color : Int, ?Factor : Float) : Int

parameters
Color In the format 0xAARRGGBB
Factor The higher, the darker! Number from 0 to 1.0.
returns
The darkened color
Darken an RGBA color.

inline getAlpha(Color : Int) : Int

parameters
Color In the format 0xAARRGGBB
returns
The Alpha component of the color, will be between 0 and 255 (0 being no Alpha, 255 full Alpha)
Given a native color value (in the format 0xAARRGGBB) this will return the Alpha component, as a value between 0 and 255

inline getAlphaFloat(Color : Int) : Float

parameters
Color In the format 0xAARRGGBB
returns
The Alpha component of the color, will be between 0 and 1 (0 being no Alpha (opaque), 1 full Alpha (transparent))
Given a native color value (in the format 0xAARRGGBB) this will return the Alpha component as a value between 0 and 1

getAnalogousHarmony(Color : Int, ?Threshold : Int) : Harmony

parameters
color The color to base the harmony on
threshold Control how adjacent the colors will be (default +- 30 degrees)
returns
Object containing 3 properties: color1 (the original color), color2 (the warmer analogous color) and color3 (the colder analogous color)
Returns an Analogous Color Harmony for the given color. An Analogous harmony are hues adjacent to each other on the color wheel Values returned in 0xAARRGGBB format with Alpha set to 255.

inline getBlue(Color : Int) : Int

parameters
Color In the format 0xAARRGGBB
returns
The Blue component of the color, will be between 0 and 255 (0 being no color, 255 full Blue)
Given a native color value (in the format 0xAARRGGBB) this will return the Blue component, as a value between 0 and 255

inline getColor24(Red : Int, Green : Int, Blue : Int) : Int

parameters
Red The Red channel value (between 0 and 255)
Green The Green channel value (between 0 and 255)
Blue The Blue channel value (between 0 and 255)
returns
A native color value integer (format: 0xRRGGBB)
Given 3 color values this will return an integer representation of it

inline getColor32(Alpha : Int, Red : Int, Green : Int, Blue : Int) : Int

parameters
Alpha The Alpha value (between 0 and 255)
Red The Red channel value (between 0 and 255)
Green The Green channel value (between 0 and 255)
Blue The Blue channel value (between 0 and 255)
returns
A native color value integer (format: 0xAARRGGBB)
Given an alpha and 3 color values this will return an integer representation of it

inline getColorInfo(Color : Int) : String

parameters
Color A color value in the format 0xAARRGGBB
returns
String containing the 3 lines of information
Returns a String containing handy information about the given color including String hex value, RGB format information and HSL information. Each section starts on a newline, 3 lines in total.

inline getComplementHarmony(Color : Int) : Int

parameters
Color The color to base the harmony on
returns
0xAARRGGBB format color value
Returns a Complementary Color Harmony for the given color. A complementary hue is one directly opposite the color given on the color wheel Value returned in 0xAARRGGBB format with Alpha set to 255.

inline getGreen(Color : Int) : Int

parameters
Color In the format 0xAARRGGBB
returns
The Green component of the color, will be between 0 and 255 (0 being no color, 255 full Green)
Given a native color value (in the format 0xAARRGGBB) this will return the Green component, as a value between 0 and 255

inline getHSBA(Color : Int, ?Results : HSBA) : HSBA

parameters
Color The color you want to break into components.
Results An optional parameter, allows you to use an array that already exists in memory to store the result.
returns
An HSBA object containing the Red, Green, Blue and Alpha values of the given color.
Loads an array with the HSB values of a Flash uint color. Hue is a value between 0 and 360. Saturation, Brightness and Alpha are as floating point numbers between 0 and 1 rounded to 4 decimals.

getHSVColorWheel(?Alpha : Int) : Array<Int>

parameters
Alpha Alpha value for each color of the color wheel, between 0 (transparent) and 255 (opaque)
returns
HSV color wheel as Array of Ints
Get HSV color wheel values in an array which will be 360 elements in size

inline getRGBA(Color : Int, ?Results : RGBA) : RGBA

parameters
Color The color you want to break into components.
Results An optional parameter, allows you to use an RGBA that already exists in memory to store the result.
returns
An RGBA object containing the Red, Green, Blue and Alpha values of the given color.
Loads an array with the RGBA values of a Flash uint color. RGB values are stored 0-255. Alpha is stored as a floating point number between 0 and 1 rounded to 4 decimals.

getRandomColor(?Min : Int, ?Max : Int, ?Alpha : Int) : Int

parameters
Min The lowest value to use for the color
Max The highest value to use for the color
Alpha The alpha value of the returning color (default 255 = fully opaque)
returns
32-bit color value with alpha
Returns a random color value between black and white Set the min value to start each channel from the given offset. Set the max value to restrict the maximum color used per channel

inline getRed(Color : Int) : Int

parameters
Color In the format 0xAARRGGBB
returns
The Red component of the color, will be between 0 and 255 (0 being no color, 255 full Red)
Given a native color value (in the format 0xAARRGGBB) this will return the Red component, as a value between 0 and 255

getSplitComplementHarmony(Color : Int, ?Threshold : Int) : Harmony

parameters
Color The color to base the harmony on
Threshold Control how adjacent the colors will be to the Complement (default +- 30 degrees)
returns
Object containing 3 properties: color1 (the original color), color2 (the warmer analogous color) and color3 (the colder analogous color)
Returns an Split Complement Color Harmony for the given color. A Split Complement harmony are the two hues on either side of the color's Complement Values returned in 0xAARRGGBB format with Alpha set to 255.

inline getTriadicHarmony(Color : Int) : TriadicHarmony

parameters
Color The color to base the harmony on
returns
Object containing 3 properties: color1 (the original color), color2 and color3 (the equidistant colors)
Returns a Triadic Color Harmony for the given color. A Triadic harmony are 3 hues equidistant from each other on the color wheel Values returned in 0xAARRGGBB format with Alpha set to 255.

inline interpolateColor(Color1 : Int, Color2 : Int, Steps : Int, CurrentStep : Int, ?Alpha : Int) : Int

parameters
Color1 The first color
Color2 The second color
Steps The amount of total steps
CurrentStep The step the interpolated color should be on
Alpha The alpha value you want the interpolated color to have
returns
The interpolated color
Get an interpolated color based on two different colors.

inline interpolateColorWithRGB(Color : Int, R2 : Int, G2 : Int, B2 : Int, Steps : Int, CurrentStep : Int) : Int

parameters
Color The first color
R2 The red value of the second color
G2 The green value of the second color
B2 The blue value of the second color
Steps The amount of total steps
CurrentStep The step the interpolated color should be on
Alpha The alpha value you want the interpolated color to have
returns
The interpolated color
Get an interpolated color based on a color and the RGB value of a second color.

inline interpolateRGB(R1 : Int, G1 : Int, B1 : Int, R2 : Int, G2 : Int, B2 : Int, Steps : Int, CurrentStep : Int) : Int

parameters
R1 The red value of the first color
G1 The green value of the first color
B1 The blue value of the first color
R2 The red value of the second color
G2 The green value of the second color
B2 The blue value of the second color
Steps The amount of total steps
CurrentStep The step the interpolated color should be on
Alpha The alpha value you want the interpolated color to have
returns
The interpolated color
Get an interpolated color based on the RGB values of two different colors.

inline makeFromHSBA(Hue : Float, Saturation : Float, Brightness : Float, ?Alpha : Float) : Int

parameters
Hue A number between 0 and 360, indicating position on a color strip or wheel.
Saturation A number between 0 and 1, indicating how colorful or gray the color should be. 0 is gray, 1 is vibrant.
Brightness A number between 0 and 1, indicating how bright the color should be. 0 is black, 1 is full bright.
Alpha How opaque the color should be, either between 0 and 1 or 0 and 255.
returns
The color as a uint.
Generate a Flash uint color from HSBA components.

inline makeFromRGBA(Red : Int, Green : Int, Blue : Int, ?Alpha : Float) : Int

parameters
Red The red component, between 0 and 255.
Green The green component, between 0 and 255.
Blue The blue component, between 0 and 255.
Alpha How opaque the color should be, either between 0 and 1 or 0 and 255.
returns
The color as a uint.
Generate a Flash uint color from RGBA components.
